title: Publications and Preprints
text:
Methodology
We define the loss function \(L(\theta)\) as follows:
\[
L(\theta) = \sum_{i=1}^{N} (y_i - f(x_i; \theta))^2 + \lambda ||\theta||^2
\]
This converges when \(\lambda \to 0\).
As discussed by D. E. Knuth (1984), literate programming is essential. However, others disagree (D. E. Knuth 1984; D. E22. Knuth 1984).
